summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Jill Greenfield, discussing preparations for a proffer interview with a client (likely a witness or victim) regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails include a detailed list of proposed questions covering the client's background, relationship with Epstein and Maxwell, allegations of sexual abuse, and awareness of other victims.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is engaging with the SDNY investigation. She is coordinating a call to discuss providing more information from her client.

persons.name: Kyle Phillips
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, likely another attorney or legal professional involved in the case.

persons.name: Louise Scott
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, likely another attorney or legal professional involved in the case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the investigation. The proposed questions seek information about her role, tasks performed for her, and her alleged involvement in sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Primary subject of the investigation. The proposed questions seek information about meeting him, working for him, and his alleged sexual abuse.

connections.description: Greenfield is an attorney representing a client who has information about Maxwell, as indicated by the discussion of a client proffer regarding Maxwell's activities.
Greenfield's client has information about Epstein, as the questions focus on the client's interactions with and abuse by Epstein.
The document's questions treat them as linked figures in the alleged abuse, asking about the client's work for "Maxwell and/or Epstein" and their joint involvement in sexual contact.
Greenfield is in communication with AUSAs from the SDNY to schedule a call and discuss her client's potential proffer.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Call
events.description: A call is scheduled between Jill Greenfield and SDNY AUSAs to discuss information from Greenfield's client regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Prior Epstein Investigation
events.description: Mentioned as a period when Epstein was under investigation, and a question asks if Epstein or Maxwell attempted to contact the client during that time.

events.title: New York Investigation
events.description: Referenced as the ongoing SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell. A question asks if either attempted to contact the client during this period.

locations: Properties owned or used by Epstein and Maxwell (referenced generally in questions)
keyFacts: SDNY prosecutors are preparing for a proffer interview with a witness/victim represented by attorney Jill Greenfield.
The proposed questions indicate the prosecutors' understanding that the client experienced abuse and worked for Epstein and Maxwell.
Questions seek specific details about the nature of work, travel, residence, and the dynamics of alleged sexual abuse involving both Epstein and Maxwell.
Prosecutors are inquiring about the client's awareness of other underage victims and any contact from Epstein or Maxwell during prior and current investigations.
The correspondence demonstrates the ongoing investigative steps being taken by the SDNY in mid-2020, following Epstein's death.
